data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: What is the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: It is an extension for ComfyUI that allows you to organize and manage all your workflows, models, and generated images in one place. It offers features like seamlessly switching between workflows, tracking version history, 1-click install of models from Civit ai, and browsing or updating installed models.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: How can I install the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: You can install it via ComfyUI Manager by searching for 'ComfyUI Workspace Manager' and then installing it, or through git by cloning the repository at https://github.com/11cafe/comfyui-workspace-manager.git in your ComfyUI root folder.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager Features
data.question: What are the features of the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: Features include workflows manager, models manager, and image gallery. The workflows manager allows you to switch between workflows easily, version control of workflow, bulk import workflows, and more. The models manager allows you to install models from Civit ai and browse installed models. The image gallery saves every image/video you generate associated with the current workflow.

data.subject: Switching between flows
data.question: How can I switch between flows in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: You can switch between flows by selecting the flow you want from the list of available flows.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: Where is my workflow and workspace data stored in the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: All your workflows are saved in a folder at `/ComfyUI/my_workflows` by default. Other metadata is primarily stored in your browser cache (IndexedDB) and backed up in your disk under `/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/comfyui-workspace-manager/db/`.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: How can I save my workflow in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: You can save your workflow by clicking the ðŸ’¾ floppy disk icon button or using the âŒ¨ **Shift+S** shortcut (customizable in Settings).

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: Is there a way to disable autosave in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: Yes, you can disable autosave in Settings if you experience UI lagging.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: What is the purpose of the Version History in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: Version History allows you to switch versions of your workflow like Git.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: Can I add tags to my workflow in ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: Yes, you can add tags to organize and categorize your workflows.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: How do I view or change the path of the folder where my workflows are saved?
data.answer: You can change the path of the folder where your workflows are saved in Settings.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: Can I share my workflow from ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: Yes, in version 2.0, there is a feature for one-click sharing to cloud to backup your workflows.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: What changes were made in the latest version of the ComfyUI Workspace Manager (v2.0)?
data.answer: Version 2.0 includes new features like two-way sync with a selected local folder, support for external models paths like Automatic1111, and one-click sharing to cloud to backup your workflows.

data.subject: Auto Save mode issues
data.question: What should I do if I updated or cloned the repo between certain dates and am experiencing issues?
data.answer: It is recommended to update to the latest version of the ComfyUI Workspace Manager.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: What are the upcoming features for ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: Upcoming features include 1-Click Install Models for missing models from Hugging Face and Civiti, modularization, multi-workflow project support, and cloud running or easy deployment of workflows.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: Can I collaborate or contribute to the development of the ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: Yes, the developers are looking for collaborators and coworkers specializing in React, Python, or ML model deployment. You can reach out to weixuanfu01@gmail.com for more information.

data.subject: ComfyUI Workspace Manager
data.question: What browsers are recommended for the best experience with ComfyUI Workspace Manager?
data.answer: It is recommended to use Chrome for the best experience. Safari has issues, but Edge and Firefox should be fine as well.
